pullRequest.body:
If `K` is a valued ring taking values in the multiplicative integers wth a zero adjoined, then `Valued.WithZeroMulInt.tendsto_zero_pow_of_le_neg_one` is the result that `x ^ n` tends to zero in this ring if `v x` is at most `-1` valued. As a result, in `adicCompletion K v`, we can always find a non-zero divisor that is arbitrarily small across a finite number of `v` (`AdicCompletion.exists_nonZeroDivisor_finset_valued_lt`).

---
- [x] depends on: #21160 
- [x] depends on: #22055

<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Why are you adding more API about `intValuationDef` instead of `intValuation`? In fact, why do we even have `intValuationDef`?
Why are you adding more API about `intValuationDef` instead of `intValuation`? In fact, why do we even have `intValuationDef`?

```suggestion
theorem uniformizer_ne_zero_of_intValuation {v : HeightOneSpectrum R} {Ï€ : R}
    (hÏ€ : v.intValuation Ï€ = Multiplicative.ofAdd (-1 : â„¤)) :
    Ï€ â‰  0 := by
```
Also this lemma is true more generally as
```suggestion
theorem uniformizer_ne_zero_of_intValuation {v : HeightOneSpectrum R} {Ï€ : R}
    (hÏ€ : v.intValuation Ï€ â‰  0) :
    Ï€ â‰  0 := by
```
right? at which point it's a contraposition away from `intValuation_zero` (which doesn't exist, even though `intValuationDef_zero`?) so probably we shouldn't have it

pullRequest.title: feat: add `Valued.WithZeroMulInt.tendsto_zero_pow_of_le_neg_one` and applications to `adicCompletion K v`

source.title: feat: the finite adele ring is locally compact if each of the ring of integers is compact
